oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RCA Studio C: interior control room view with window
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of a historic recording studio. The control room is divided from the performance room by a large plate glass window.

Studio C was built by Chet Atkins circa 1969-70 by converting some office space at the complex at 30 Music Square West. Numerous artists, including Waylon Jennings, Merle Haggard, and Willie Nelson have recorded in this studio.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Sound studios
recording studios
